qas.question: When did King Philip the II annex Thessaly and Magnesia?
When was the Battle of Chaeronea?
Who formed the League of Corinth?
Who was Philip II planning a campaign against when he was assasinated?

context: <a1_0>Philip II<a1_0/> was a strong and expansionist king and he took every opportunity to expand Macedonian territory. In <a0_0>352 BC<a0_0/> he annexed Thessaly and Magnesia. In <a2_0>338 BC<a2_0/>, Philip defeated a combined Theban and Athenian army at the Battle of Chaeronea after a decade of desultory conflict. In the aftermath, <a3_0>Philip<a3_0/> formed the League of Corinth, effectively bringing the majority of Greece under his direct sway. He was elected Hegemon of the league, and a campaign against the <a4_0>Achaemenid Empire of Persia<a4_0/> was planned. However, while this campaign was in its early stages, he was assassinated.
